title: Test Go code with GitHub actions
%note add info about testing actions locally

inline_content.Text: %note add info about testing actions locally

title: GitHub Actions allow you to run code in your repository, on GitHub servers, after every push.

inline_content.Text: GitHub Actions allow you to run code in your repository, on GitHub servers, after every push.

title: This can be used for many things. This article discusses how to use it for running tests (as a replacement for hosted CI services like travis.ci).

inline_content.Text: This can be used for many things. This article discusses how to use it for running tests (as a replacement for hosted CI services like travis.ci).

title: A GitHub Action is defined by a
Dockerfile
c
in some GitHub repository. Since you can have multiple actions, you create a directory for each action.

inline_content.Text: A GitHub Action is defined by a
in some GitHub repository. Since you can have multiple actions, you create a directory for each action.

title: An action is triggered by a workflow description in
.github/main.workflow
c
file in a repository.

inline_content.Text: An action is triggered by a workflow description in

title: Workflow is specific to each repository, actions can be shared.

inline_content.Text: Workflow is specific to each repository, actions can be shared.

title: A workflow running time (a sum of all actions in a workflow) is limited to 1 hr.

inline_content.Text: A workflow running time (a sum of all actions in a workflow) is limited to 1 hr.

title: run go test on push
c
is human-readable name of the workflow. It documents what the action is for

inline_content.Text: is human-readable name of the workflow. It documents what the action is for

title: on = "push"
c
says that workflow will be executed on each push (including pushes into branches)

inline_content.Text: says that workflow will be executed on each push (including pushes into branches)

title: resolves = ["test"]
c
specifies a list of actions to execute. We just have one and it refers to
action "test"
c

inline_content.Text: specifies a list of actions to execute. We just have one and it refers to

title: For a full list of options see
documentation
a
https://developer.github.com/actions/managing-workflows/workflow-configuration-options/

inline_content.Text: For a full list of options see

title: test
c
is a name by which we can refer an action from a workflow

inline_content.Text: is a name by which we can refer an action from a workflow

title: uses
c
specifies a location of the action

inline_content.Text: specifies a location of the action

title: For simplicity I put the action in the same repository that uses the action but I could, for example, create a separate repository just for actions and re-use them in multiple repos.

inline_content.Text: For simplicity I put the action in the same repository that uses the action but I could, for example, create a separate repository just for actions and re-use them in multiple repos.

title: Actions are Docker containers (describing docker is beyond the scope of this article).

inline_content.Text: Actions are Docker containers (describing docker is beyond the scope of this article).

title: Docker containers are infinitely flexible: you can run any logic in the container.

inline_content.Text: Docker containers are infinitely flexible: you can run any logic in the container.

title: Our goal is to simply run
go test
c
on our code.

inline_content.Text: Our goal is to simply run

title: Dockerfile
c
describes how to build a container (with
docker build
c

inline_content.Text: describes how to build a container (with

title:
FROM golang:latest

LABEL "name"="Go test"

LABEL "com.github.actions.name"="Go test"
LABEL "com.github.actions.description"="Run go test on code"
LABEL "com.github.actions.icon"="package"
LABEL "com.github.actions.color"="#E0EBF5"

COPY entrypoint.sh /entrypoint.sh

ENTRYPOINT ["/entrypoint.sh"]

content_resolved.code:
FROM golang:latest

LABEL "name"="Go test"

LABEL "com.github.actions.name"="Go test"
LABEL "com.github.actions.description"="Run go test on code"
LABEL "com.github.actions.icon"="package"
LABEL "com.github.actions.color"="#E0EBF5"

COPY entrypoint.sh /entrypoint.sh

ENTRYPOINT ["/entrypoint.sh"]

c

title: A file
action-go-test/entrypoint.sh
c
describes the code that will be executed when we run the container with
docker run
c
. It runs
go test
c

inline_content.Text: describes the code that will be executed when we run the container with

title: set -e
c

tells bash to stop execution when a command fails, as opposed to continue executing the rest of the script. If a compilation fails, you don't want to run the test. In our case we only have one command
go test
c
so it makes no difference, but it's a good habit to have in case we'll expand the script in the future

inline_content.Text: tells bash to stop execution when a command fails, as opposed to continue executing the rest of the script. If a compilation fails, you don't want to run the test. In our case we only have one command
so it makes no difference, but it's a good habit to have in case we'll expand the script in the future
